intro: Polypodium longicuspe, commonly known as the long-leaf polypody, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds that are typically 30–60 cm in length. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rhizomes are creeping and produce numerous sporangia on the underside of the fronds. The longicuspe species is notable for its ability to adapt to a variety of soil types, making it a common sight in forest understories.
